emerging_technologies.name: Decentralized AI Governance Networks
emerging_technologies.description: A system where AI governance decisions are made through decentralized networks, ensuring transparency and collective decision-making in AI development and application.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduces the risk of monopolistic AI control, promotes ethical AI practices, but may face challenges with decision speed and accountability.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption depends on regulatory acceptance, technological maturity of blockchain, and the willingness of AI developers to relinquish some control.

emerging_technologies.name: Neural Interface Markets
emerging_technologies.description: Markets for trading and selling neural data, cognitive enhancements, and experiences, all secured via blockchain.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Potential for enhancing human capabilities but raises privacy issues, ethical concerns about cognitive inequality, and security risks.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Adoption hinges on privacy laws, public perception of cognitive enhancements, and the development of reliable neural interfaces.

emerging_technologies.name: Tokenized Space Resource Rights
emerging_technologies.description: A system to tokenize and trade rights to extraterrestrial resources, enabling investment and ownership in space assets.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could spur space exploration but might lead to new forms of space colonialism or resource conflicts.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires international space law agreements, technological breakthroughs in space travel, and market demand for space resources.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI-Driven Smart Contracts
mainstream_technologies.description: Smart contracts that utilize AI to adapt and execute based on complex conditions and external data.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widespread adoption in legal, financial, and insurance sectors for automated, trustworthy transactions.

mainstream_technologies.name: Decentralized Energy Grid Management
mainstream_technologies.description: A decentralized system where energy production, distribution, and consumption are managed through blockchain for transparency and efficiency.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Becoming standard in regions with advanced renewable energy adoption, significantly reducing energy waste.

epoch_themes.description: A shift towards decentralization in various sectors to enhance security, transparency, and democratization.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Promotes a more democratic approach to technology but challenges existing power structures and governance models.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Rise of decentralized finance (DeFi), increased push for data sovereignty, and a move away from centralized control in many sectors.

epoch_themes.description: The commercialization of space activities, focusing on resource extraction, tourism, and extraterrestrial settlements.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Could lead to economic expansion but also raises questions about space law, ethics, and environmental impact.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Investment in space technology, new space race among nations and private entities, and public-private partnerships in space exploration.
